image.altText: A photo of an alleged murder victim at her funeral.

props.synopsis: The grieving family, friends and fiance of Adelaide mother-of-two Julie Seed, who was allegedly murdered at her workplace in December, have paid heartfelt tribute to her at her funeral, with her daughters describing her as a "beautiful angel" who was "perfect in every way".

title.children: Julie Seed, victim of alleged workplace murder, remembered as 'beautiful angel' by mourners

image.altText: A house with crime tape

props.synopsis: Police say they will interview the victim today after finding bullet holes at the address in Adelaide's north-west.

title.children: Early morning shooting leaves Adelaide teenager in hospital, with police saying attack was not random

image.altText: A woman in a dark room looks out a window

props.synopsis: A South Australian woman suffering a potentially fatal heart condition lodges a complaint with Adelaide’s biggest public hospital after it postponed her open-heart surgery amid mounting pressure on the state’s health system.

title.children: Adelaide woman fights for elective heart surgery amid long wait lists in SA public hospitals

image.altText: Bite marks and dents on the underside of a white surfboard

props.synopsis: The attack off South Australia's Eyre Peninsula happened about 200 metres from the beach, with the man able to make his own way back to shore.

title.children: Surfer takes himself to hospital after shark bites his leg

image.altText: A female shopper, wearing a green top and jeans, looks at vegetables in a supermarket.

props.synopsis: The latest monthly indicator from the ABS shows consumer prices rose at their slowest pace in almost two years in November.

title.children: Inflation falls to the lowest level in almost two years

image.altText: A close up of a cacti dotting a desert underneath a blazing sun.

props.synopsis: While it's already been called the world's hottest year, the full set of climate data up to December 31 shows global temperatures reached "exceptionally" high levels in 2023.

title.children: Take a look at 2023's record-breaking temperatures in graphs and photos

image.altText: A supermarket employee walking down an isle with food stocked on shelves.

props.synopsis: The federal government says it will use all options available to make sure supermarkets are pricing goods fairly, as it announces a former Labor minister was quietly appointed before Christmas to continue the government's groceries probe.

title.children: Government threatens to pull 'all levers' to ensure supermarkets pass on cost savings, as grocery code review continues

image.altText: Water in Mary St, Rochester

props.synopsis: While residents in some Victorian towns assess damage as floodwaters recede, the northern city of Shepparton faces a nervous wait as its river rises. Follow live.

title.children: Victorian flood emergency moves to Shepparton as recovery begins in some towns

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Roads and shared pathways closed in Shepparton
Residents cleared to return to Rochester

image.altText: A woman with a neutral expression leans on a fence and looks at the camera. She is surrounded by historic buildings

props.synopsis: From today, the "international LGBT movement" will be considered an extremist organisation in Russia in a development that has sparked panic among many in the queer community but caused some to ask: has the court banned something that doesn't actually exist?

title.children: A Russian court 'banned something that doesn't exist', and it changed these peoples' lives

image.altText: Cameron Green holds up his finger

props.synopsis: Cameron Green has been named to play in the Adelaide Test against West Indies, with Australia opting against a specialist opener to replace David Warner.

title.children: Opener spot still up for grabs as Green, Renshaw named in Australia squad for West Indies Tests

image.altText: A man with fair hair, wearing black jacket and light shirt, smiles with mouth closed. He's surrounded by bushes.

props.synopsis: As John Gilius's partner came closer to dying from terminal cancer, the couple decided to mark the event in a very special, and very joyous, way.

title.children: John didn't believe death should be sad and lonely. So he threw a party

image.altText: A man with long hair and a beard, wearing t-shirt and shorts without shoes, with three uniformed court sheriffs

props.synopsis: A 25-year-old man faces court charged with numerous child exploitation offences after he was arrested in South Australia as part of a police investigation prompted by information from Queensland's Taskforce Argos.

title.children: Man accused of hosting child exploitation website arrested after Taskforce Argos tip-off

image.altText: Cyclone forecast for third week of January 2024

props.synopsis: The trough in the Gulf of Carpentaria is expected to turn into a tropical low next week, increasing the risk of a cyclone in a region still recovering after Jasper.

title.children: BOM tracking possibility of another cyclone impacting Far North Queensland next week

image.altText: cash lays on a kitchen table beside a cup of tea and a list of bills owing

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is trading lower after a weaker session on Wall Street, while data shows inflation fell to 4.3 per cent in the 12 months to November. Follow live.

title.children: Inflation drops to 4.3pc in November, ASX down after shares ease ahead of US inflation figures

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX slumps at lunch despite better-than-expected inflation data
ANZ says interest rates have peaked, but any cuts are off the table until late 2024
Slowing inflation suggests 'we won't see a rate hike' from the RBA next month

image.altText: A woman's silhouette in a doorframe.

props.synopsis: Evie was 12 when she went into the care of the Department of Child Safety under the promise of better mental health care in regional Queensland. Now, her family is fighting to bring her home.

title.children: Evie's mum sought mental health care help for her daughter, she's now fighting Child Safety for guardianship

image.altText: Australian tennis player Arina Rodionova shrugs while holding a tennis racquet.

props.synopsis: Arina Rodionova says Tennis Australia will be "celebrating" because she will not play the Australian Open after missing out on a wildcard and losing in qualifying.

title.children: 'I am not liked': Top-ranked Aussie woman says decision not to give her an AO wildcard feels personal

image.altText: Emergency services clearing a path through fallen trees.

props.synopsis: Ashleigh and her four children under six years of age survived 11 days without power after the Gold Coast storms, and her disaster assistance payment will barely scratch the surface.

title.children: Disaster assistance leaves Gold Coast residents heavily out of pocket after storm damage costs

image.altText: Court sketch of blonde haired Donald Trump and lawyers

props.synopsis: A Washington court questions Mr Trump's claim he is immune from criminal charges for trying to overturn Joe Biden's 2020 win.

title.children: 'You can't have a president without immunity': Trump says court has no right to prosecute him over 2020 election

image.altText: A man with a wreath on his head stands on a podium with a medal

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian rowing champion who won silver at the 2004 Athens Olympics pleads guilty over breaches of a family violence order and injury to property.

title.children: Olympic rower Simon Burgess pleads guilty to family violence order breaches

image.altText: A woman of African descent, with a tear rolling down her cheeks, holding her hands to the sky crying

props.synopsis: Yiel Gatlauk, 19, was found dead on a remote road east of Alice Springs on New Year's Day, prompting a homicide investigation. His mother says his last words to her were "I love you".

title.children: Family of 19-year-old found dead in suspicious circumstances near Alice Springs pleads for answers

image.altText: Smoke rises during an explosion with severely damaged buildings seen near a low hill.

props.synopsis: The Lebanese armed group attacks Israeli border posts and an army headquarters in retaliation for the recent killings of top Hamas and Hezbollah officials, while Israel says intense fighting will continue in southern Gaza.

title.children: Hezbollah launches drone strike on base in northern Israel, intense combat continues in southern Gaza

image.altText: Phoebe, as Frances, leans out a car window and smiles while looking into the distance.

props.synopsis: Trent Dalton's bestselling debut novel Boy Swallows Universe cemented his place in Australia's literary landscape. Now, a seven-part Netflix series is about to bring his epic coming-of-age saga to a global audience.

title.children: Trent Dalton's Boy Swallows Universe goes from page to screen in star-studded Netflix adaptation

image.altText: Shot of a television screen showing masked holding person

props.synopsis: Viewers watched as masked gun-wielding assailants entered the TV studio, with gunshots heard in the background of a live broadcast.

title.children: Ecuadorian TV studio taken over by gunmen after drug lord escapes jail

image.altText: A smiling older man wearing a dark shirt.

props.synopsis: Amen Gutugutuwai was at the forefront of Pacific Islanders breaking through in Australian rugby league, but his impact was felt far beyond the boundaries of the sport.

title.children: Farewelling a legend who went from sleeping rough and eating bats to changing Australia

image.altText: A close shot of a man wearing a suit and tie against a black background.

props.synopsis: The protracted battle over secrecy in the now defunct prosecution of lawyer Bernard Collaery is finally over, five years after he was charged with breaching national security laws, with a redacted appeal ruling released.

title.children: Judge gave 'too much weight' to national security in deciding if Bernard Collaery matters should be heard in open court

image.altText: Joe Biden and Lloyd Austin talk to each other

props.synopsis: Questions about transparency swirl as it is revealed the US president only learned Lloyd Austin was diagnosed with prostate cancer almost three weeks after the defence secretary underwent surgery.

title.children: Biden kept in dark about secretary of defence's  prostate cancer

image.altText: Lucy Cox with Wildaliz De Jesús and Lucy's grandson Zamarn. They sit together in a cafe and smile to the camera.

props.synopsis: Many people with disability are affected by extreme heat. Musician Lucy Cox says if you're feeling isolated, lean on the help and company of others.

title.children: 'Don't sit on your own': Finding community and help during heatwaves

image.altText: Woman holds microphone

props.synopsis: A tribute concert for Irish singers O'Connor and The Pogues frontman Shane MacGowan is planned for Carnegie Hall on March 20.

title.children: Irish singer Sinéad O'Connor died from natural causes, coroner reveals

image.altText: A full Moon illuminates the sky behind a rocket with a US flag and NASA logo on it, which sits on a launchpad

props.synopsis: The US space agency pushes back Moon flights due to safety and technical issues, after the Peregrine lander suffered a major blow.

title.children: Fuel leak forces US company to abandon soft Moon landing, as NASA delays lunar astronaut missions

image.altText: An electric bike leaning against a terrace fence.

props.synopsis: Strata schemes grappling with the fire risk of lithium-ion batteries are also advised to ban modified and cheaper imported devices.

title.children: Limits on charging e-bike and e-scooter batteries proposed to reduce fire risk

image.altText: Large grey fly with orange eyes on a leaf.

props.synopsis: You may want every fly to buzz off this summer, but according to a nature writer, some deserve an invitation because the overwhelming majority of more than 30,000 species in Australia are too busy doing good deeds to have an interest in your barbecue.

title.children: Summer is here and flies are everywhere, but what's the buzz on the good and the bad?

image.altText: Sign showing warning about magpies swooping.

props.synopsis: Emma Glenfield wants to know why magpies swoop. She's conducting some cutting-edge research — and displaying her results with Lego.

title.children: Do magpies target you? This eight-year-old's viral research could explain why

image.altText: Renee Oakley squats down between two very happy Golden Retrievers

props.synopsis: While most take time off over summer to holiday and enjoy life, many Australians work through the traditional break, sacrificing their family time to keep businesses and emergency services running.

title.children: For Renee Oakley, summer is a time of work 'chaos' rather than a holiday
